docs.title: Welcome to News from Loop and Learn
docs.text:
Published on 17 September 2023.

In this edition:

  • Upcoming Zoom Sessions
  • Questions and Answers from the Facebook Group
  • Enhancements to Profiles Customization
  • Loop Follow for iAPS
  • iOS 17

docs.title: Upcoming Zoom Sessions
docs.text:
• 21 September 2023, 18:00 UTC: Topic Loop: Open
  • Later in September 2023, to be announced: Topic iAPS

docs.title: Video Replay
docs.text: • 10 September 2023; Loop Caregiver Video Replay

docs.title: Questions and Answers from the Facebook Group
docs.text:
• Can there be more than one settings profile in Loop?

    • Facebook Post

  • When I eat carbs to treat low glucose, should those carbs be entered into Loop?

    • Facebook Post

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
Our Profile feature, crafted to swiftly save and transition between therapy setting subsets tailored to your needs, has received a significant upgrade. Thanks to your invaluable feedback, here's what's new:

  • Active Profile Indicator: Quickly identify your current profile with a clear checkmark.
  • Manual Profile Sorting: Organize your profiles exactly how you want them.
  • Profile Update Alert: Made changes to your therapy settings? Loop will now suggest updating your profile. Alternatively, save these new settings as a separate profile.
  • Profile Renaming: Regret the initial name? Now you can change to a new one.

This customization is compatible with both released (main branch) and development (dev branch) versions.

docs.title: How to Customize
docs.text:
If you don't already use customization, use this link for more information.

  • Customization Select Script Overview

docs.title: Building the app in a Browser with GitHub Actions
docs.text: If you've already incorporated the Profiles customization, simply repeat the GitHub Build Action and then install from TestFlight.

docs.title: Building the app with Mac-Xcode
docs.text: Execute the Customization Select Script and an update option will be presented.

docs.title: Loop Follow for iAPS
docs.text:
We're excited to share that the official Loop Follow app has now been upgraded to support users using iAPS (formerly known as FreeAPS X). A hearty acknowledgment goes to Auggie Fisher, whose pioneering work in a separate fork made this integration feasible.

For our iAPS followers, some of the features were not previously available in the FAX fork, but are now at your disposal:

  • Building the app in a Browser with GitHub Actions
  • Auto-signing
  • Automatic workspace selection
  • And other LoopFollow enhancements

As always, we thrive on feedback and collaboration. Test the waters with the revamped Loop Follow and let the iAPS community know your impressions.

docs.title: iOS 17
docs.text: Last week, we recommended upgrading to iOS 16.6.1 and WatchOS 9.6.2 for important security updates. We also recommended waiting to update to iOS 17, as it’s still in beta and your Loop phone is a medical device. Beta is going well, but we are not changing these recommendations quite yet.

docs.title: Google Translate Links
docs.text:
Click on a language from the list above to turn on Google's automatic translation.

  • Every edition of News from  Loop and Learn gets automatically translated to the selected language as do some of the hyperlinks from the pages.
  • The Google Translate Tool will appear at the top of each page
    • Google Translate Tool Instructions
    • Google Translate Help Link

Automatic Translation

These links connect this site to the Google Translation service.

  • No human has reviewed the translated information for accuracy
  • Please use the translation with care
  • Not available in all regions
  • Some links may not work as expected

docs.title: Google Translate Tool Instructions
docs.text:
Once Google Translate has been turned on, clicking on a language link above shows a "Google Translate: Can't translate this page error".

  • To modify the language for a single page, use the Google Translate tool
  • To modify the language for the entire site, see Change Language

The graphic below shows the Google Translate Tool when maximized (default) for a browser and mobile display. The tool can be minimized by tapping on the up/down carets at the right of the tool. This is very useful if the tool obstructs part of the original screen. Additional options can be selected with the three-dot menu as shown in the graphic.

docs.title: Change Language
docs.text:
To modify the language choice for the whole site, copy the line below and paste it into the URL and then choose the desired language from the list

Copy and Paste in Browser URL to return to original version
https://loopandlearn.github.io/news/translate

OR

Use the Google Translation three-dot menu and select Go to Original URL while on the Translation page.

docs.title: Welcome to News from Loop and Learn
docs.text:
Published on 11 September 2023.

In this edition:

  • Upcoming Zoom Sessions
  • Time to Update iPhone and Watch
  • Questions and Answers from the Facebook Group
  • Update your Apple Developer Agreement
  • LoopDocs Remote Commands

docs.title: Upcoming Zoom Sessions
docs.text:
• 13 September 2023, 11:00 UTC: Topic Loop: Open
  • 21 September 2023, 18:00 UTC: Topic Loop: Open
  • Later in September 2023, to be announced: Topic iAPS

docs.title: Video Replay
docs.text: • 10 September 2023; Loop Caregiver Video Replay

docs.title: Time to Update iPhone and Watch
docs.text:
Updating your phone to iOS 16.6.1 and watch to WatchOS 9.6.2 will provide important security updates. Thanks to our friends at Looped Norge for the heads-up.

Please Note: We recommend waiting to update to iOS 17, as it’s still in beta and your Loop phone is a medical device

docs.title: Questions and Answers from the Facebook Group
docs.text:
• Which brand of insulin do you find effective for children? Is there a difference between generic and branded insulin?
    • Facebook Post

docs.title: Update your Apple Developer Agreement
docs.text: PLEASE update your Apple Developer Agreement before Tuesday, 12 September... and expect to need to do so again soon. This is especially important for Browser builders, but is also important for Xcode builders. It will help keep your Loop app working.

docs.title: LoopDocs Remote Commands
docs.text:
Please take a look at the major rewrite of the Remote Commands section in the Nightscout Tab of LoopDocs. What was one page (remote-overrides.md) has been reorganized into 5 pages:

  • Remote Overview
  • Remote Configuration
  • Remote Commands
  • Remote Errors
  • Loop Caregiver

Feedback is always welcomed on zulipchat
